pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:0.5: 53. The training rule on reviling a group
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.2: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was quarrelsome and argumentative, and she created legal issues in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.3: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā objected.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.4: Soon afterwards when Thullanandā went to a village on some business,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.6: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not recognizing an offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.7: When Thullanandā had finished her business, she returned to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.8: As she was approaching, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, or water for washing the feet;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.9: and she did not go out to meet her to receive her bowl and robe or to ask whether she wanted water to drink.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.11: why she was acting like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.13: She replied, “That’s how it is, Venerable, when one doesn’t have a protector.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.14: “But how is it, Venerable, that you don’t have a protector?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.16: that no one would speak up for me because I am not esteemed by them and I didn’t have a protector, they ejected me for not recognizing an offense.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.18: “They are incompetent fools! They don’t understand legal procedures, nor what makes them fail or succeed.” And being furious, she reviled the community.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.19: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.20: “How could Venerable Thullanandā revile the community because she is furious?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.21: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.24: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.26: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.27.1: ‘If a furious nun reviles a community, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.8: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.10: if she reviles them, saying, “They are incompetent fools. They don’t understand legal procedures, nor what makes them fail or succeed,” she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.11: If she reviles several nuns, a single nun, or someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.13: if she is aiming at something beneficial;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.14: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.15: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.17: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.18: The third training rule is finished.
